Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: Even in the grave, all is not lost.

Author: Dante Alighieri
Quote: The path to paradise begins in hell.

Author: Horace
Quote: We are but dust and shadows.

Author: George R.R. Martin
Quote: Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.

Author: Sigmund Freud
Quote: The goal of all life is death.

Author: Francis Bacon
Quote: It is natural to die as to be born.

Author: Socrates
Quote: Death may be the greatest of all human blessings.

Author: H.P. Lovecraft
Quote: Do not call up that which you cannot put down.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Quote: Not all those who wander are lost.
